findings.title: Incompatibility with Deflationary/Rebasing Tokens
findings.description: The SZNSChef contract is incompatible with deflationary/rebasing tokens due to its asset-transferring routines only working as expected with standard ERC20 tokens.

findings.title: Potential Reentrancy Risk In SZNSChef
findings.description: The `deposit()`, `withdraw()`, and `emergencyWithdraw()` functions have potential reentrancy risk due to non-adherence of checks-effects-interactions principle, which can lead to malicious contract re-entrance.

findings.title: Recommended Explicit Pool Validity Checks
findings.description: The contract SZNSChef does not perform explicit sanity checks on pool validity when updating rewards, querying pending rewards, staking, or unstaking, relying instead on implicit compiler-generated bound-checks of arrays.

findings.title: Accommodation of Non-ERC20-Compliant Tokens
findings.description: The `transfer` function does not follow the ERC20 standard specification, which may cause issues if not handled properly.

findings.title: Trust Issue of Admin Keys
findings.description: In the SZNS protocol, there are certain privileged accounts, i.e., _owner, admin, minter and pauser. When examining the related contracts, i.e., Album and SZNSToken, we notice inherent trust on these privileged accounts.

findings.title: Improved Sanity Checks Of System/Function Parameters
findings.description: The `buyout()` function in the `AlbumBuyoutManager` contract lacks additional sanity checks.
